intro: Ruellia variabilis, commonly known as the variable ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruellia variabilis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it adaptable to a variety of garden conditions.
